p: Globally, GII.4 genotype has been responsible for most gastroenteritis outbreaks and sporadic cases related to NoV since the 1990s. Pandemic variants of GII.4 emerge every two or 3 years and cause multiple epidemics of gastroenteritis [ 8]. During the 2014–2015 season, the GII.17_2014 (Kawasaki) pandemic variant emerged and caused gastroenteritis outbreaks in schools, colleges, factories, and kindergartens in the Guangdong province, China [ 9]. In China, 24 (82.8%) of the 29 outbreaks (2340 cases) reported during 2014–2015 were caused by GII.17_2014. Between 2013 and 2014, only nine outbreaks with 949 cases were recorded. These outbreaks were predominantly caused by the GII.4 Sydney 2012 genotype [ 9].
